doc:
Luis van Rooten https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luis_van_Rooten 0 Luis d'Antin van Rooten (November 29, 1906 – June 17, 1973) was a Mexican-born American actor. Van Rooten was born in in Mexico City, Mexico, to parents who spoke Italian, Spanish and French, and emigrated to the United States with his parents when he was eight, growing up in Pennsylvania. He earned his BA at the University of Pennsylvania and worked as an architect before deciding to pursue film work in Hollywood during World War II. His facility with languages made van Rooten an in-demand military radio announcer during the war, and he conducted a variety of broadcasts in Italian, Spanish, and French. This led into film work, often in roles requiring an accent or skill with dialects. He was sometimes credited as Louis Van Rooten. Luis_d'Antin_van_Rooten ( November_29_,_1906 – June_17_,_1973 ) was a_Mexican-born_American_actor . Van_Rooten was_born in in Mexico_City , Mexico , to parents who spoke Italian_,_Spanish_and_French , and emigrated to the_United_States with his_parents when he was eight , growing up in Pennsylvania . He earned his_BA at the_University of Pennsylvania and worked as an_architect before deciding_to_pursue film_work in Hollywood during World_War_II . His_facility with languages made van_Rooten an_in-demand_military_radio_announcer during the_war , and he conducted a_variety of broadcasts in Italian_,_Spanish_,_and_French . This led into film_work , often in roles requiring an_accent_or_skill with dialects . He was_sometimes_credited as Louis_Van_Rooten .
